attributes.action: A full audit of covid relief fund spending by devolved governments.
attributes.additional_details: Businesses in the devolved regions shouldn't have to suffer because of funds diverted from tax payers to independence causes on the whim of nationalists
attributes.background:
The SNP in Scotland has openly admitted it diverted funds ring-fenced for hospitality, and has kept back £150m of other business relief.

The National Audit Office should investigate where this, and other funding, has disappeared to.

rejection.details:
The National Audit Office audits central Government departments, government agencies and non-departmental public bodies. Audit Scotland is responsible for audit of the public sector in Scotland. You can find out more here: https://www.audit-scotland.gov.uk/.

You could start a petition calling on the Government to review the terms under which future Coronavirus relief funding is made available to the devolved Governments, if that is something you'd like to happen.
